clinical_study.brief_title: Tai Chi for Comorbid Depression in T2DM Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Tai Chi for Comorbid Depression in T2DM Patients: A Randomized Controlled Trial Protocol

clinical_study.source: Chengdu University of Traditional Chinese Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: Previous studies suggested that Tai Chi may be beneficial for T2DM patients. However, no studies have investigated the effectiveness of Tai Chi for comorbid depression in T2DM patients, as well as the optimal frequency of Tai Chi. Thus, we intend to investigate the effectiveness of Tai Chi for comorbid depression in T2DM patients and test whether the effectiveness of Tai Chi depends on its frequency.

arm_group.description: 5 sessions of Tai Chi per week for 12 weeks
3 sessions of Tai Chi per week for 12 weeks

Participants will maintain their routine treatment and life style for 12 weeks.

intervention.description: 24-form Tai Chi will be performed for 12 weeks. Each session contains a warm-up period (10 minutes), a Tai Chi period (40 minutes) and a cool-down period (10 minutes).
CBT will be performed once a week for 12 weeks. Each session lasts for 1 hour.
